Explanations about Options.-s: stabilize sort by disabling last-resort comparison
Explanations about Options.-z: line delimiter is NUL, not newline

au_1182473: ls -r all_files/*.pdf

(cd all_files && ls -r -- *.pdf)

ls -1r all_files/*.pdf

(cd all_files && ls -1r -- *.pdf)

ls --reverse

ls -1 --reverse all_files/*.pdf

ls -r all_files/!(*.docx)

(cd all_files && ls -r -- !(*.docx))

(shopt -s extglob; ls -r all_files/!(*.docx))

(shopt -s extglob; cd all_files && ls -r -- !(*.docx))

Explanations about Options.-w: set output width to COLS. 0 means no limit
Explanations about Options.-t: sort by modification time , newest first
Explanations about Options.-m: fill width with a comma separated list of entries
Explanations about Options.-n: like -l, but list numeric user and group IDs

ul_600268: find . -type f -print0 | while IFS= read -d '' -r l ; do print "${${l%.*}##*/}" ; done

Explanations about Options.-print0:
Always print the exact filename, unchanged, even if the output is going to a
 terminal.
Explanations about Options.-iname:
Like -name, but the match is case insensitive. For example, the patterns `fo*' and
 `F??' match the file names `Foo', `FOO', `foo', `fOo', etc. The pattern `*foo*`
 will also match a file called '.foobar'.

Explanations about Options.-U: Do not sort. Lists files in directory order. Disables --dirsfirst.
